dt: {bc}a long shallow often V-shaped receptacle for the drinking water or feed of domestic animals
{bc}any of various domestic or industrial containers
{bc}a conduit, drain, or channel for water
{bc}a gutter along the eaves of a building
{bc}a long and narrow or shallow channel or depression (as between waves or hills)
{bc}a long but shallow depression in the bed of the sea {dx}compare {dxt|trench||}{/dx}
{bc}the minimum point of a complete cycle of a periodic function: such as
{bc}an elongated area of low barometric pressure
{bc}the low point in a business cycle

et: Middle English, from Old English {it}trog{/it}; akin to Old High German {it}trog{/it} trough, Old English {it}trēow{/it} tree, wood {ma}{mat|tree:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: a long shallow often V-shaped receptacle for the drinking water or feed of domestic animals
any of various domestic or industrial containers
a conduit, drain, or channel for water; especially : a gutter along the eaves of a building
